title: Web UI error: delete queue
body:
Ruby version: ruby 2.2.6p396
Sidekiq / Pro / Enterprise version(s): sidekiq-4.2.9, sidekiq-pro-3.4.2

### Steps to reproduce:

* Go to /sidekiq in the web UI
* Click on "Queues"
* Click to delete a queue

### Error:

```
Rack::Lint::LintError at /sidekiq/queues/default
No Content-Type header found

 /usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/lint.rb: in assert
              raise LintError, message...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/lint.rb: in check_content_type
          assert("No Content-Type header found") {...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/lint.rb: in _call
          check_content_type status, headers...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/lint.rb: in call
          dup._call(env)...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/showexceptions.rb: in call
          @app.call(env)...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/commonlogger.rb: in call
          status, header, body = @app.call(env)...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/chunked.rb: in call
          status, headers, body = @app.call(env)...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/rack-1.4.7/lib/rack/content_length.rb: in call
          status, headers, body = @app.call(env)...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/unicorn-5.2.0/lib/unicorn/http_server.rb: in process_client
        status, headers, body = @app.call(env = @request.read(client))...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/unicorn-5.2.0/lib/unicorn/http_server.rb: in worker_loop
              process_client(client)...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/unicorn-5.2.0/lib/unicorn/http_server.rb: in spawn_missing_workers
            worker_loop(worker)...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/unicorn-5.2.0/lib/unicorn/http_server.rb: in start
        spawn_missing_workers...

/usr/local/bundle/gems/unicorn-5.2.0/bin/unicorn: in <top (required)>
    Unicorn::HttpServer.new(app, options).start.join...

bin/unicorn: in load
    load Gem.bin_path('unicorn', 'unicorn')...

bin/unicorn: in <main>
    load Gem.bin_path('unicorn', 'unicorn')...
```

This came up after updating gems from sidekiq-pro 3.3 to 3.4. Based on the changelog, my guess is this is just an oversight from dropping Sinatra.
